com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver

Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.Equation

  • public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an algebraic equation
    Author:
    Nateowami

      private Expression[] exprs 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Equation(java.lang.String eq)
      Creates an equation by turning it into two expressions

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAsString() 
      Expression getExpression(int i) 
      int getSize()
      Tells the length/number of expressions in this Equation This seems unnecessary (there would usually be two) but there could be only one if Equation holds only one expression, or more if it represents a system of equations.

      Sets the specified expression in this equation to the specified expression

        private Expression[] exprs

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.lang.String eq)
        Creates an equation by turning it into two expressions
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation (or expression) to turn into an equation, which can be just an expression if necessary

    • Method Detail

      • getExpression

        public Expression getExpression(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - The expression you want in this equation. Needs to be 0 or 1.
        Returns:
        The expression at index i

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Tells the length/number of expressions in this Equation This seems unnecessary (there would usually be two) but there could be only one if Equation holds only one expression, or more if it represents a system of equations.
        Returns:
        The number of expressions in this Equation

      • setExpression

        public void setExpression(java.lang.String expr,
                 int index)
        Sets the specified expression in this equation to the specified expression
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression you want to change it to
        index - The index of the Expression you want to change

      • getAsString

        public java.lang.String getAsString()
        Returns:
        A String representation of this equation. Example: 2x+x=5
